Constructor Detail

DateUtil

public DateUtil()
Method Detail

formatTime

public static java.lang.String formatTime(java.util.Date date)
Creates a label of the form "9:15am". TODO: support 24 hour time for people who go for that sort of thing. If date is null the empty string is returned.

formatDate

public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date)
Formats the supplied date relative to the current time: Today, Yesterday, MMM dd, and finally MMM dd, YYYY. If date is null the empty string is returned.

formatDate

public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,
                                          boolean useShorthand)
Formats the supplied date relative to the current time: Today, Yesterday, MMM dd, and finally MMM dd, YYYY. If date is null the empty string is returned.

Parameters:
useShorthand - if false, "Today" and "Yesterday" will not be used, only the month/day and month/day/year formats.

formatDateTime

public static java.lang.String formatDateTime(java.util.Date date)
Creates a label of the form "formatDate(java.util.Date) at formatTime(java.util.Date)". If date is null the empty string is returned.

toDate

public static java.util.Date toDate(int[] datevec)

toDateVec

public static int[] toDateVec(java.util.Date date)

newDate

public static java.util.Date newDate(java.lang.String dateStr)

getDayOfMonth

public static int getDayOfMonth(java.util.Date date)

getMonth

public static int getMonth(java.util.Date date)

getYear

public static int getYear(java.util.Date date)
Returns the year component of the supplied date. Note: this is not the year minus 1900 which the underlying Date.getYear() method returns. It's the actual year. Returning years since 1900 is stupid.

zeroTime

public static void zeroTime(java.util.Date date)
